title: Mild Curry Powder Recipe
description: A fragrant yellow curry powder to use in soups, sauces, rice, and anything else you can think of!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Indian Mild Curry Powder 4.4 (52) 43 Reviews 4 Photos A fragrant yellow curry powder to use in soups, sauces, rice, and anything else you can think of! Submitted by Curry Updated on July 14, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 Prep Time: 2 mins Total Time: 2 mins Servings: 20 Yield: 1/4 cup Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 20 servings 2 tablespoons ground cumin 2 tablespoons ground coriander 2 teaspoons ground turmeric ½ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes ½ teaspoon mustard seed ½ teaspoon ground ginger Directions In a blender or food processor, combine cumin, coriander, turmeric, red pepper flakes, mustard seed, and ginger. Process to a fine powder. Store in an airtight container. I Made It Print 106 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. name: Curry
instructions: In a blender or food processor, combine cumin, coriander, turmeric, red pepper flakes, mustard seed, and ginger. Process to a fine powder. Store in an airtight container.
